intro: Calochortus palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a single flower per stem, which blooms in the spring. Calochortus palmeri is also known for its ability to survive in arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native environment.
